translated: The Elder Nuns’ Verses of the Therīs
The Chapter with Sumedhā
The Elder Nun Sattuppalamālikā’s Verses
In the city of Aruṇavatī,
there was a noble named Aruṇa;
I was the wife of that king,
I was a woman who restrained.
Taking seven garlands,
blue lotuses fragrant with the scent of the gods,
sitting in the best of palaces,
I thought like this for a while:
‘What is the use of these garlands
placed on my head?
It would be better for me if I placed
knowledge on the head of the Buddha, the best.’
Paying homage to the Sambuddha,
I sat down near the door,
thinking: ‘When the Sambuddha comes,
I will worship the Great Sage.’
Kakudha, as if playing,
like a lion, the king of beasts,
the Victor, together with the Community of monks,
came to the street.

analyzed: buddhassa rasim disvāna  haṭṭhā sa vigga mānasā
translated: Seeing the radiance of the Buddha,🔽elated, with a mind full of urgency,
opening the door,
I worshipped the Buddha, the best.
The seven blue lotus flowers,
surrounded by the sky,
making a canopy for the Buddha,
they held above his head.
With uplifted heart, with joy,
with consciousness full of rapture,
having set my heart on that,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.
The great Nerañjara tree,
they hold above my head;
I waft divine perfumes,
this fruit of the blue lotus.

analyzed: kadācid nīyamānāya  ñāti saṅghena me tadā
translated: Sometimes, when I was being carried,🔽by my kinsmen’s assembly then,
as far as the assembly was mine,
the great Nerañjara was held.
To the seventy kings of the gods,
I made great offerings;
having become a lord everywhere,
I transmigrate through existence and rebirth.
To the seventy-two world-rulers,
I made great offerings;
all of them followed me,
and my word was accepted.
My complexion is like the blue lotus,
and the fragrance wafts around;
I do not know what it is to be ugly,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.🔽I am skilled in the bases of spiritual power,
I delight in the development of the factors of awakening;
I have attained perfection in the higher knowledges,

analyzed: buddha pūjāyidam  sati paṭṭhāna kusalā  samādhi jhāna gocarā
translated: this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.🔽I am skilled in the foundations of mindfulness,🔽I have the range of the concentration and meditation;
I am devoted to the right endeavours,
This is the result of worshipping the Buddha.🔽My energy was my draft animal,
which carried me to the state of safety,
All my pollutants are exhausted,
there is no more renewed existence for me.
Thirty-one aeons ago,
the flower I worshipped,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the result of worshipping the Buddha.
My defilements are burnt up,
I live undefiled.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.
The four analytical insights,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ sattuppalamālikā bhikkhunī imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam sattuppalamālikā bhikkhunī imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the nun Sattuppalā, who had such great supernormal power, such great and mighty virtue, spoke these verses.
The Story of the Elder Nun Sattuppalā is finished.
